<@UM3V8V1NK> <@U37KPJ30D> I'm on the ISTE review board for a potential new vendor to replace D2L. 

For that, I need to know what we did for D2L from a high level. Please get that to me as soon as you can, so I can review the new vendor's API to see how likely it is a fit.

I need to give Darren and their executive team a high level evaluation early next week.

messages.text: <@U02JFCNHKHB> Please find the document that covers the key aspects of the D2L implementation.

files.name: Salesforce - D2L - A high level summary.pdf
files.title: Salesforce - D2L - A high level summary.pdf

elements.text: Please find the document that covers the key aspects of the D2L implementation.

messages.text:
`TL;DR`
*Salesforce - D2L Brightspace : Functional Overview*

*Functional Pieces in Salesforce*
• System of record for *students, courses, and enrollments*
• *EDA data model* (Contacts, Courses, Offerings, Connections)
• *Contacts* = Users in D2L
• *Course Connections* = Enrollments
• *Program Plans & Sequences* = Auto progression
• *Custom objects* for exceptions & detailed grading
*Functional Pieces in D2L Brightspace*
• System of delivery for *learning & teaching*
• *Course Offerings* = live course runs per term
• *Enrollments & Roles* = students, instructors, TAs
• *Dropbox* = submissions & grading
• *Grades* = central gradebook + rubrics
• *Awards* = certificates/badges
• *Special Access* = exceptions for learners
*Integration Touchpoints*
• *Salesforce —> D2L*
    ◦ Provision Users
    ◦ Sync Course Offerings
    ◦ Enroll learners (Course Connections)
    ◦ Push Special Access
• *D2L —> Salesforce*
    ◦ Course completions
    ◦ Grades & rubrics
    ◦ Awards / certificates
    ◦ Enrollment/classlist reconciliation
*User Journeys*
1. *Enrollment* – Contact created in Salesforce → provisioned in D2L → enrolled in correct course.
2. *During Course* – Learner engages in D2L; exceptions pushed from Salesforce.
3. *Completion* – D2L sends completions, awards, grades → Salesforce updates records.
4. *Progression* – Salesforce auto-enrolls learner into next course in sequence.

elements.text: – Contact created in Salesforce → provisioned in D2L → enrolled in correct course.
– Learner engages in D2L; exceptions pushed from Salesforce.
– D2L sends completions, awards, grades → Salesforce updates records.
– Salesforce auto-enrolls learner into next course in sequence.

messages.text: Awesome. The TL;DR is perfect :+1:
No replacement
But, we will be doing a full rebuild. Most of what we did was just reinventing the wheel because ISTE didn't want to change their ways. We are going to reshape it to use as much as D2L as possible.

elements.text: But, we will be doing a full rebuild. Most of what we did was just reinventing the wheel because ISTE didn't want to change their ways. We are going to reshape it to use as much as D2L as possible.

messages.text:
For tomorrow, focus on listing out all the integration options: 

1. What must be passed between D2L and SF
2. What could be passed from D2L to SF, but not absolutely necessary 
3. What cannot be passed between the two, or can be passed but not recommended
This will give us a good picture on how to divide the LA responsibilities between D2L and SF. 

Do this in the morning, so we can review and selectively dive deeper later in the day. We need to decide if we want to attend the meeting with D2L by the end of tomorrow, so I can inform Brian in his early afternoon.
